name: Use private API Gateway endpoints
description: Ensure that API Gateway endpoints are configured as private to restrict access to only within the VPC. This prevents unauthorized access from the public internet and enhances the security of your APIs.

name: Enable AWS X-Ray tracing for API Gateway REST API stages
description: Enable AWS X-Ray active tracing for all API Gateway REST API stages to gain insights into the performance and behavior of your APIs, facilitating troubleshooting and optimization.

name: Attach AWS WAF ACL to API Gateway stages
description: Ensure that all API Gateway stages have an AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) ACL attached to protect against common web exploits and malicious traffic.

name: Enable logging for API Gateway stages
description: Enable comprehensive logging for all API Gateway stages to capture detailed information about requests and responses, aiding in security analysis and troubleshooting.

name: Enable client certificate authentication for backend endpoints
description: Configure client certificate authentication for API Gateway stages to securely access backend endpoints, ensuring that only authorized clients can communicate with your backend services.

name: Encrypt API Gateway REST API cache data at rest
description: Ensure that all methods in API Gateway REST API stages with caching enabled have encryption configured for data at rest, using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) for enhanced security.

name: Configure authorizers for API Gateway at API or method level
description: Implement appropriate authorizers (such as AWS IAM, Lambda authorizers, or Amazon Cognito user pools) at either the API or method level to control access to your API resources.

name: Use latest TLS security policy for API Gateway custom domain names
description: Ensure that API Gateway custom domain names are configured with the latest TLS security policy to enforce strong encryption for data in transit.

name: Enable request validation for API Gateway methods
description: Configure request validation for API Gateway methods to ensure that incoming requests meet specified criteria, reducing the risk of invalid or malicious inputs.

name: Implement throttling for API Gateway methods
description: Configure appropriate throttling limits for API Gateway methods to protect backend services from being overwhelmed by excessive requests and to mitigate potential DoS attacks.

name: Enable API Gateway caching with encryption
description: Enable caching for API Gateway stages and methods where appropriate, ensuring that cached data is encrypted using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) to protect sensitive information.

name: Disable detailed execution logging in API Gateway method settings
description: Ensure that detailed execution logging (Data Trace) is disabled in API Gateway method settings to prevent potential exposure of sensitive information in logs.

name: Implement API key validation for API Gateway methods
description: Configure API key validation for appropriate API Gateway methods to control and monitor access to your APIs, enabling usage plans and throttling based on API keys.

name: Enable mutual TLS authentication for API Gateway custom domain names
description: Configure mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication for API Gateway custom domain names to ensure that both the client and server verify each other's certificates, providing an additional layer of security.

name: Implement resource policies for API Gateway APIs
description: Configure resource policies for API Gateway APIs to control access from specific AWS accounts, VPC endpoints, or IP ranges, enhancing the security posture of your APIs.
